warehouse.name: warehouse
warehouse.description: This is the main module of warehouse.

Database.name: Database
Database.description: Manages all models and stores data.

Query.name: Query
Query.description:
The query constructor.

Warehouse uses a MongoDB-like way to query documents.

**Logical operators**

You can use an array of two or more expressions in logical operators. For example:

``` js
query.find({
  $or: [{comments: true}, {published: false}]
});
```

- **$or** - Performs a logical `OR` operation
- **$and** - Performs a logical `AND` operation
- **$not** - Performs a logical `NOT` operation
- **$nor** - Performs a logical `NOR` operation

SchemaType.name: SchemaType

classitems.description: Returns the number of items in the model.

classitems.description:
Updates documents matching the `conditions` in the model.
`conditions` can be either a query object or the id of the document.
classitems.name: update

classitems.description: Combines the old and the new data.
classitems.name: _update

classitems.description: Updates a document in the model by id.
classitems.name: updateById

classitems.description:
Replaces documents matching the `conditions` in the model.
`conditions` can be either a query object or the id of the document.

Removes documents matching the `conditions` in the model.
`conditions` can be either a query object or the id of the document.

classitems.description: Saves a document to the model.
classitems.name: save

classitems.description: Deletes all documents in the model.
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description:
Returns the document at the specified index.
`num` can be a positive or negative number.
classitems.name: eq

classitems.description:
Returns the first document in the model.

This method is an alias of:

``` js

```
classitems.name: first

classitems.description:
Returns the last document in the model.

This method is an alias of:

``` js

```

classitems.name: slice

Limits the number of items returned.

This method is an alias of:

``` js

```
classitems.name: limit

classitems.description:
Specifies the number of items to skip.

This method is an alias of:

``` js
model.slice(num);
`

classitems.description: Returns the query in reversed order.
classitems.name: reverse

classitems.description:
Sorts the documents in the query.

Example:

``` js
query.sort('date', -1);
query.sort({date: -1, title: 1});
```

If the `order` equals to `-1`, `desc` or `descending`, the data will be returned in reversed order.
classitems.name: sort

classitems.description: Returns the documents in the query in random order.
classitems.name: random

classitems.description: Finds the matching documents in the query.
classitems.name: find

props.description: The maximum number of items in the result
